comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: Third Dynasty 2649-2575 BC -  Step mastaba Pyramid of Pharaoh Djoser  - AKA Pharoh Djozer, Zoser -  reputed to be the design of physician architect Imhotep, who was revered (with his own temples) for nearly 1,000 yrs, as the God Protector of architects and physicians.  The discovery that honey held infections away, and aided in healing, is also attributed to Imhotep.

comment.author: 24307136@N05
comment._content: eita bichim pra me dar medo esse tal de Egito.

comment.author: 36148417@N08
comment._content: Can anyone tell us how high this pyramid is, from the base to the top?

comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: "....The Step Pyramid itself, rising to a height of about 60 meters (197 feet), in six steps and containing some 330,400 cubic meters (11,668,000 cubic feet) of clay and stone..." found on this site: www.touregypt.net/featurestories/dsteppyramid1.htm also here: www.saqqara.nl/saqqara/landmarks/step-pyramid-of-djoser
